038/**
039 * Provides different utilities methods to apply processing from a security perspective.<br>
040 * These code snippet can be used, as "foundation", to customize the validation to the app context.<br>
041 * These code snippet were implemented in a way to facilitate adding or removal of validations depending on usage context.<br>
042 * These code snippet were centralized on one class to be able to enhance them across time as well as missing case/bug identification.<br>
043 */
044public class SecurityUtils {
045
046    /**
047     * Default constructor: Not needed as the class only provided static methods.
048     */
049    private SecurityUtils() {
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Apply a collection of validation to verify if a provided PIN code is considered weak (easy to guess) or none.<br>
054     * This method consider that format of the PIN code is [0-9]{6,}<br>
055     * Rule to consider a PIN code as weak:<br>
056     * - Length is inferior to 6 positions.<br>
057     * - Contain only the same number or only a sequence of zero.<br>
058     * - Contain sequence of following incremental or decremental numbers.<br>
059     *
060     * @param pinCode PIN code to verify.
061     * @return True only if the PIN is considered as weak.
062     */
063    public static boolean isWeakPINCode(String pinCode) {
064        boolean isWeak = true;
065        //Length is inferior to 6 positions
066        //Use "Long.parseLong(pinCode)" to cause a NumberFormatException if the PIN is not a numeric one
067        //and to ensure that the PIN is not only a sequence of zero
068        if (pinCode != null && Long.parseLong(pinCode) > 0 && pinCode.trim().length() > 5) {
069            //Contain only the same number
070            String regex = String.format("^[%s]{%s}$", pinCode.charAt(0), pinCode.length());
071            if (!Pattern.matches(regex, pinCode)) {
072                //Contain sequence of following incremental or decremental numbers
073                char previousChar = 'X';
074                boolean containSequence = false;
075                for (char c : pinCode.toCharArray()) {
076                    if (previousChar != 'X') {
077                        int previousNbr = Integer.parseInt(String.valueOf(previousChar));
078                        int currentNbr = Integer.parseInt(String.valueOf(c));
079                        if (currentNbr == (previousNbr - 1) || currentNbr == (previousNbr + 1)) {
080                            containSequence = true;
081                            break;
082                        }
083                    }
084                    previousChar = c;
085                }
086                if (!containSequence) {
087                    isWeak = false;
088                }
089            }
090        }
091        return isWeak;
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Apply a collection of validations on a Word 97-2003 (binary format) document file provided:<br>
096     * - Real Microsoft Word 97-2003 document file.<br>
097     * - No VBA Macro.<br>
098     * - No embedded objects.<br>
099     *
100     * @param wordFilePath Filename of the Word document file to check.
101     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
102     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/"
103     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/document/"
104     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/poifs/how-to.html"
105     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/poifs/embeded.html"
106     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/"
107     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.poi/poi"
108     */
109    public static boolean isWord972003DocumentSafe(String wordFilePath) {
110        boolean isSafe = false;
111        try {
112            File wordFile = new File(wordFilePath);
113            if (wordFile.exists() && wordFile.canRead() && wordFile.isFile()) {
114                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid Word 97-2003 format file
115                try (POIFSFileSystem fs = new POIFSFileSystem(wordFile)) {
116                    //Step 2: Check if the document contains VBA macros, in our case is not allowed
117                    VBAMacroReader macroReader = new VBAMacroReader(fs);
118                    Map<String, String> macros = macroReader.readMacros();
119                    if (macros == null || macros.isEmpty()) {
120                        //Step 3: Check if the document contains any embedded objects, in our case is not allowed
121                        //From POI documentation:
122                        //Word normally stores embedded files in subdirectories of the ObjectPool directory, itself a subdirectory of the filesystem root.
123                        //Typically, these subdirectories and named starting with an underscore, followed by 10 numbers.
124                        final List<String> embeddedObjectFound = new ArrayList<>();
125                        DirectoryEntry root = fs.getRoot();
126                        if (root.getEntryCount() > 0) {
127                            root.iterator().forEachRemaining(entry -> {
128                                if ("ObjectPool".equalsIgnoreCase(entry.getName()) && entry instanceof DirectoryEntry) {
129                                    DirectoryEntry objPoolDirectory = (DirectoryEntry) entry;
130                                    if (objPoolDirectory.getEntryCount() > 0) {
131                                        objPoolDirectory.iterator().forEachRemaining(objPoolDirectoryEntry -> {
132                                            if (objPoolDirectoryEntry instanceof DirectoryEntry) {
133                                                DirectoryEntry objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry = (DirectoryEntry) objPoolDirectoryEntry;
134                                                if (objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry.getEntryCount() > 0) {
135                                                    objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry.forEach(objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry -> {
136                                                        if (objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry.isDocumentEntry()) {
137                                                            embeddedObjectFound.add(objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry.getName());
138                                                        }
139                                                    });
140                                                }
141                                            }
142                                        });
143                                    }
144                                }
145                            });
146                        }
147                        isSafe = embeddedObjectFound.isEmpty();
148                    }
149                }
150            }
151        } catch (Exception e) {
152            isSafe = false;
153        }
154        return isSafe;
155    }
156
157    /**
158     * Ensure that an XML file does not contain any External Entity, DTD or XInclude instructions.
159     *
160     * @param xmlFilePath Filename of the XML file to check.
161     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
162     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/xxe"
163     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/XML_External_Entity_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html#java"
164     * @see "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/13/security/java-api-xml-processing-jaxp-security-guide.html#GUID-82F8C206-F2DF-4204-9544-F96155B1D258"
165     * @see "https://www.w3.org/TR/xinclude-11/"
166     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XInclude"
167     */
168    public static boolean isXMLSafe(String xmlFilePath) {
169        boolean isSafe = false;
170        try {
171            File xmlFile = new File(xmlFilePath);
172            if (xmlFile.exists() && xmlFile.canRead() && xmlFile.isFile()) {
173                //Step 1a: Verify that the XML file content does not contain any XInclude instructions
174                boolean containXInclude = Files.readAllLines(xmlFile.toPath()).stream().anyMatch(line -> line.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT).contains(":include "));
175                if (!containXInclude) {
176                    //Step 1b: Parse the XML file, if an exception occur than it's imply that the XML specified is not a valid ones
177                    //Create an XML document builder throwing Exception if a DOCTYPE instruction is present
178                    DocumentBuilderFactory dbfInstance = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
179                    dbfInstance.setFeature("http://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl", true);
180                    //Xerces 2 only
181                    //dbfInstance.setFeature("http://xerces.apache.org/xerces2-j/features.html#disallow-doctype-decl",true);
182                    dbfInstance.setXIncludeAware(false);
183                    DocumentBuilder builder = dbfInstance.newDocumentBuilder();
184                    //Parse the document
185                    Document doc = builder.parse(xmlFile);
186                    isSafe = (doc != null && doc.getDocumentElement() != null);
187                }
188            }
189        } catch (Exception e) {
190            isSafe = false;
191        }
192        return isSafe;
193    }
194
195
196    /**
197     * Extract all URL links from a PDF file provided.<br>
198     * This can be used to apply validation on a PDF against contained links.
199     *
200     * @param pdfFilePath pdfFilePath Filename of the PDF file to process.
201     * @return A List of URL objects that is empty if no links is found.
202     * @throws Exception If any error occurs during the processing of the PDF file.
203     * @see "https://www.gushiciku.cn/pl/21KQ"
204     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
205     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
206     */
207    public static List<URL> extractAllPDFLinks(String pdfFilePath) throws Exception {
208        final List<URL> links = new ArrayList<>();
209        File pdfFile = new File(pdfFilePath);
210        try (PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(pdfFile)) {
211            PDDocumentCatalog documentCatalog = document.getDocumentCatalog();
212            AnnotationFilter actionURIAnnotationFilter = new AnnotationFilter() {
213                @Override
214                public boolean accept(PDAnnotation annotation) {
215                    boolean keep = false;
216                    if (annotation instanceof PDAnnotationLink) {
217                        keep = (((PDAnnotationLink) annotation).getAction() instanceof PDActionURI);
218                    }
219                    return keep;
220                }
221            };
222            documentCatalog.getPages().forEach(page -> {
223                try {
224                    page.getAnnotations(actionURIAnnotationFilter).forEach(annotation -> {
225                        PDActionURI linkAnnotation = (PDActionURI) ((PDAnnotationLink) annotation).getAction();
226                        try {
227                            URL urlObj = new URL(linkAnnotation.getURI());
228                            if (!links.contains(urlObj)) {
229                                links.add(urlObj);
230                            }
231                        } catch (MalformedURLException e) {
232                            throw new RuntimeException(e);
233                        }
234                    });
235                } catch (Exception e) {
236                    throw new RuntimeException(e);
237                }
238            });
239        }
240        return links;
241    }
242
243    /**
244     * Apply a collection of validations on a PDF file provided:<br>
245     * - Real PDF file<br>
246     * - No attachments.<br>
247     * - No Javascript code.<br>
248     * - No links using action of type URI/Launch/RemoteGoTo/ImportData.<br>
249     *
250     * @param pdfFilePath Filename of the PDF file to check.
251     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
252     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/a/36161267"
253     * @see "https://www.gushiciku.cn/pl/21KQ"
254     * @see "https://github.com/jonaslejon/malicious-pdf"
255     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
256     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
257     */
258    public static boolean isPDFSafe(String pdfFilePath) {
259        boolean isSafe = false;
260        try {
261            File pdfFile = new File(pdfFilePath);
262            if (pdfFile.exists() && pdfFile.canRead() && pdfFile.isFile()) {
263                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid PDF file
264                try (PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(pdfFile)) {
265                    //Step 2: Check if the file contains attached files, in our case is not allowed
266                    PDDocumentCatalog documentCatalog = document.getDocumentCatalog();
267                    PDDocumentNameDictionary namesDictionary = new PDDocumentNameDictionary(documentCatalog);
268                    if (namesDictionary.getEmbeddedFiles() == null) {
269                        //Step 3: Check if the file contains Javascript code, in our case is not allowed
270                        if (namesDictionary.getJavaScript() == null) {
271                            //Step 4: Check if the file contains links using action of type URI/Launch/RemoteGoTo/ImportData, in our case is not allowed
272                            final List<Integer> notAllowedAnnotationCounterList = new ArrayList<>();
273                            AnnotationFilter notAllowedAnnotationFilter = new AnnotationFilter() {
274                                @Override
275                                public boolean accept(PDAnnotation annotation) {
276                                    boolean keep = false;
277                                    if (annotation instanceof PDAnnotationLink) {
278                                        PDAnnotationLink link = (PDAnnotationLink) annotation;
279                                        PDAction action = link.getAction();
280                                        if ((action instanceof PDActionURI)
281                                                || (action instanceof PDActionLaunch)
282                                                || (action instanceof PDActionRemoteGoTo)
283                                                || (action instanceof PDActionImportData)
284                                        ) {
285                                            keep = true;
286                                        }
287                                    }
288                                    return keep;
289                                }
290                            };
291                            documentCatalog.getPages().forEach(page -> {
292                                try {
293                                    notAllowedAnnotationCounterList.add(page.getAnnotations(notAllowedAnnotationFilter).size());
294                                } catch (IOException e) {
295                                    throw new RuntimeException(e);
296                                }
297                            });
298                            if (notAllowedAnnotationCounterList.stream().reduce(0, Integer::sum) == 0) {
299                                isSafe = true;
300                            }
301                        }
302                    }
303                }
304            }
305        } catch (Exception e) {
306            isSafe = false;
307        }
308        return isSafe;
309    }
310
311    /**
312     * Remove as much as possible metadata from the provided PDF document object.
313     *
314     * @param document PDFBox PDF document object on which metadata must be removed.
315     * @see "https://gist.github.com/righettod/d7e07443c43d393a39de741a0d920069"
316     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
317     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
318     */
319    public static void clearPDFMetadata(PDDocument document) {
320        if (document != null) {
321            PDDocumentInformation infoEmpty = new PDDocumentInformation();
322            document.setDocumentInformation(infoEmpty);
323            PDMetadata newMetadataEmpty = new PDMetadata(document);
324            document.getDocumentCatalog().setMetadata(newMetadataEmpty);
325        }
326    }
327
328
329    /**
330     * Validate that the URL provided is really a relative URL.
331     *
332     * @param targetUrl URL to validate.
333     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
334     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/ssrf"
335     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/q/6785442"
336     */
337    public static boolean isRelativeURL(String targetUrl) {
338        boolean isValid = false;
339        //Reject any URL encoded content and URL starting with a double slash
340        //Reject any URL contains credentials or fragment to prevent potential bypasses
341        String work = targetUrl;
342        if (!work.contains("%") && !work.contains("@") && !work.contains("#") && !work.startsWith("//")) {
343            //Creation of a URL object must fail
344            try {
345                new URL(work);
346                isValid = false;
347            } catch (MalformedURLException mf) {
348                //Last check to be sure (for prod usage compile the pattern one time)
349                isValid = Pattern.compile("^/[a-z0-9]+", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE).matcher(work).find();
350            }
351        }
352        return isValid;
353    }
354
355    /**
356     * Apply a collection of validations on a ZIP file provided:<br>
357     * - Real ZIP file<br>
358     * - Contain less than a specified level of deepness.<br>
359     * - Do not contain Zip-Slip entry path.<br>
360     *
361     * @param zipFilePath       Filename of the ZIP file to check.
362     * @param maxLevelDeepness  Threshold of deepness above which a ZIP archive will be rejected.
363     * @param rejectArchiveFile Flag to specify if presence of any archive entry will cause the rejection of the ZIP file.
364     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
365     * @see "https://rules.sonarsource.com/java/type/Security%20Hotspot/RSPEC-5042"
366     * @see "https://security.snyk.io/research/zip-slip-vulnerability"
367     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zip_bomb"
368     * @see "https://github.com/ptoomey3/evilarc"
369     * @see "https://github.com/abdulfatir/ZipBomb"
370     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/cs/zip-bomb"
371     * @see "https://thesecurityvault.com/attacks-with-zip-files-and-mitigations/"
372     * @see "https://wiki.sei.cmu.edu/confluence/display/java/IDS04-J.+Safely+extract+files+from+ZipInputStream"
373     */
374    public static boolean isZIPSafe(String zipFilePath, int maxLevelDeepness, boolean rejectArchiveFile) {
375        List<String> archiveExtensions = Arrays.asList("zip", "tar", "7z", "gz", "jar", "phar", "bz2", "tgz");
376        boolean isSafe = false;
377        try {
378            File zipFile = new File(zipFilePath);
379            if (zipFile.exists() && zipFile.canRead() && zipFile.isFile() && maxLevelDeepness > 0) {
380                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid ZIP file
381                try (ZipFile zipArch = new ZipFile(zipFile)) {
382                    //Step 2: Parse entries
383                    long deepness = 0;
384                    ZipEntry zipEntry;
385                    String entryExtension;
386                    String zipEntryName;
387                    boolean validationsFailed = false;
388                    Enumeration<? extends ZipEntry> entries = zipArch.entries();
389                    while (entries.hasMoreElements()) {
390                        zipEntry = entries.nextElement();
391                        zipEntryName = zipEntry.getName();
392                        entryExtension = zipEntryName.substring(zipEntryName.lastIndexOf(".") + 1).toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT).trim();
393                        //Step 2a: Check if the current entry is an archive file
394                        if (rejectArchiveFile && archiveExtensions.contains(entryExtension)) {
395                            validationsFailed = true;
396                            break;
397                        }
398                        //Step 2b: Check that level of deepness is inferior to the threshold specified
399                        if (zipEntryName.contains("/")) {
400                            //Determine deepness by inspecting the entry name.
401                            //Indeed, folder will be represented like this: folder/folder/folder/
402                            //So we can count the number of "/" to identify the deepness of the entry
403                            deepness = zipEntryName.chars().filter(ch -> ch == '/').count();
404                            if (deepness > maxLevelDeepness) {
405                                validationsFailed = true;
406                                break;
407                            }
408                        }
409                        //Step 2c: Check if any entries match pattern of zip slip payload
410                        if (zipEntryName.contains("..\\") || zipEntryName.contains("../")) {
411                            validationsFailed = true;
412                            break;
413                        }
414                    }
415                    if (!validationsFailed) {
416                        isSafe = true;
417                    }
418                }
419            }
420        } catch (Exception e) {
421            isSafe = false;
422        }
423        return isSafe;
424    }
425
426    /**
427     * Identify the mime type of the content specified (array of bytes).<br>
428     * Note that it cannot be fully trusted (see the tweet '1595824709186519041' referenced), so, additional validations are required.
429     *
430     * @param content The content as an array of bytes.
431     * @return The mime type in lower case or null if it cannot be identified.
432     * @see "https://twitter.com/righettod/status/1595824709186519041"
433     * @see "https://tika.apache.org/"
434     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.tika/tika-core"
435     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types"
436     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml"
437     */
438    public static String identifyMimeType(byte[] content) {
439        String mimeType = null;
440        if (content != null && content.length > 0) {
441            Detector detector = new DefaultDetector(MimeTypes.getDefaultMimeTypes());
442            Metadata metadata = new Metadata();
443            try {
444                try (TemporaryResources temporaryResources = new TemporaryResources(); TikaInputStream tikaInputStream = TikaInputStream.get(new ByteArrayInputStream(content), temporaryResources, metadata)) {
445                    MediaType mt = detector.detect(tikaInputStream, metadata);
446                    if (mt != null) {
447                        mimeType = mt.toString().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
448                    }
449                }
450            } catch (IOException ioe) {
451                mimeType = null;
452            }
453        }
454        return mimeType;
455    }
456}
